title: profile_emissions.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) emissions_profile_any_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_any_companies)) # FIXME User toy_emissions_profile_products_ecoinvent() # See https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltToyData/pull/12 # https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltWorkflows/issues/9 emissions_profile_products <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_products))

title: profile_emissions.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: emissions_profile <- profile_emissions(   companies = emissions_profile_any_companies,   co2 = emissions_profile_products,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic,   low_threshold = 1 / 3,   high_threshold = 2 / 3 ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

title: profile_emissions_upstream.Rmd
text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. Consider adjusting chunks parameter manually. Aim balance memory-usage speed. small number chunks makes chunk bigger may overwhelm memory. large number chunks may take longer overhead caching chunk.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rappdirs) library(future) library(fs)  # Masking `tiltIndicatorAfter::profile*()` to use `chunks` title: profile_emissions_upstream.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. “upstream” workflows also need dataset. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) ecoinvent_inputs <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_inputs)) emissions_profile_any_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_any_companies)) # FIXME User toy_emissions_profile_upstream_products_ecoinvent() # See https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltToyData/pull/12 # https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltWorkflows/issues/9 emissions_profile_upstream_products <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_upstream_products))

title: profile_emissions_upstream.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: emissions_profile_upstream <- profile_emissions_upstream(   companies = emissions_profile_any_companies,   co2 = emissions_profile_upstream_products,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_inputs = ecoinvent_inputs,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic,   low_threshold = 1 / 3,   high_threshold = 2 / 3 ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

title: profile_sector.Rmd
text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. Consider adjusting chunks parameter manually. Aim balance memory-usage speed. small number chunks makes chunk bigger may overwhelm memory. large number chunks may take longer overhead caching chunk.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rappdirs) library(future) library(fs)  # Masking `tiltIndicatorAfter::profile*()` to use `chunks` title: profile_sector.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) sector_profile_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_companies)) sector_profile_any_scenarios <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_any_scenarios))

title: profile_sector.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: sector_profile <- profile_sector(   companies = sector_profile_companies,   scenarios = sector_profile_any_scenarios,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic,   low_threshold = 1 / 3,   high_threshold = 2 / 3 ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

title: profile_sector_upstream.Rmd
text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. Consider adjusting chunks parameter manually. Aim balance memory-usage speed. small number chunks makes chunk bigger may overwhelm memory. large number chunks may take longer overhead caching chunk.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rappdirs) library(future) library(fs)  # Masking `tiltIndicatorAfter::profile*()` to use `chunks` title: profile_sector_upstream.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. “upstream” workflows also need dataset. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) ecoinvent_inputs <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_inputs)) sector_profile_upstream_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_upstream_companies)) sector_profile_any_scenarios <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_any_scenarios)) sector_profile_upstream_products <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_upstream_products))

title: profile_sector_upstream.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: sector_profile_upstream <- profile_sector_upstream(   companies = sector_profile_upstream_companies,   scenarios = sector_profile_any_scenarios,   inputs = sector_profile_upstream_products,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_inputs = ecoinvent_inputs,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic,   low_threshold = 1 / 3,   high_threshold = 2 / 3 ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

what: Handling large datasets and long run times
title: tiltWorkflows
text: tiltWorkflows package handles large *companies dataset splitting chunks fit computer’s memory, running multiple chunks parallel across multiple cores. entire process may still take long time, tiltWorkflows caches intermediate results can interrupt process point resume later without recomputing completed chunks. may enough , can still complete job faster. can run multiple processes complementary way interruption.

what: Running multiple processes in a complementary way
title: tiltWorkflows
text: Multiple processes can cooperate complete chunks faster possible single process. can twice faster two processes run workflow feed cache work chunks reverse order parameter order = 'rev'. can run workflow multiple processes number ways: Launch multiple instance RStudio click Knit. Write multiple .R files run background job RStudio: multiple instances Terminal use Rscript R expression: even faster results use parameter order = 'sample' run many processes want.
code: # job1.R rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd')  # job2.R rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd', params = list(order = 'rev')) # Terminal 1 Rscript -e "rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd')"  # Terminal 2 Rscript -e "rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd', params = list(order = 'rev'))"

what: Makes it Easy to Run TILT Workflows
title: Makes it Easy to Run TILT Workflows
text: goal tiltWorkflows make easy run tilt workflows. Main features: Easily access toy inputs try workflow. Easily access workflow file. Use data without writing code. Easily share reproducible report GitHub. Run large datasets normally saturate computer’s memory. Run faster normal running multiple chunks data parallel. Resume interruptions without recomputing completed chunks.

title: Makes it Easy to Run TILT Workflows
text: can install development version r-universe: GitHub: trouble? Try fresh new project https://posit.cloud/ (free).
